channel.title: PyBites - Modules
channel.description: A Community that Masters Python through Code Challenges

item.title: 3 Cool Things You Can do With the dateutil Module
item.description: In this short article I will show you how to use dateutil's parse, relativedelta and rrule to make it easier to work with datetimes in Python.
item.dc:creator: Bob

item.title: How to Use Pdb to Debug Your Code
item.description: The larger part of our coding time is spent reading and debugging code already written. For this Python's pdb is an unmissable module in your Python toolbox. In this article I show you the most common options and some practical examples.
item.dc:creator: Bob

item.title: PyBites Module of the Week: Openpyxl - Automate Excel!
item.description: You probably remember your first script. I remember the joy of discovering how I could let the machine automate something for me. It still gets me excited everyday. I played a bit with openpyxl yesterday. I used it to hack an Excel game for which I first used a macro. Not particularly useful but a nice exploration of this module.
item.dc:creator: Bob

item.title: Fully Automate Login and Banner Generation with Selenium, Requests and Click
item.description: In part 3 of the PyBites Banner Generator article series I show you how to automatically generate a banner with Requests and Selenium.
item.dc:creator: Bob

item.title: Using Pillow to Create Nice Banners For Your Site
item.description: Running your site or business good chance you A. use promo material like banners and B. you make them manually with Photoshop, Gimp or what not. And yes for anything beyond the basics you probably need those programs. But what if you like to keep it simple and want to semi-automate things? Just an image and text on canvas? Enter Pillow - The friendly PIL fork, which makes this pretty easy. Come explore some of its capabilities with me in this article.
item.dc:creator: Bob

item.title: PyBites Module of the Week - Pexpect
item.description: A brief overview of the pexpect module
item.dc:creator: Julian

item.title: PyBites Module of the Week - Pendulum
item.description: A brief overview of the Pendulum datetime module.
item.dc:creator: Julian

item.title: Using Python Requests on a Page Behind a Login
item.description: In this post I discuss using the requests module on web pages behind a login
item.dc:creator: Julian

item.title: PyBites Module of the Week - ipaddress
item.description: While playing around with code for our post on generators we discovered the ipaddress module, part of the Standard Library. Such a handy little module!
item.dc:creator: Julian

item.title: PyBites Module of the Week - Requests-cache for Repeated API Calls
item.description: Today a quick article on a nice caching module when working with APIs: Requests-cache.
item.dc:creator: Bob

item.title: 5 cool things you can do with itertools
item.description: Itertools is a very useful module. In this short post I show some 5 examples how you can use it. Some of this stuff might be useful in next week's challenge ...
item.dc:creator: Bob
